1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Read data resource.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Core.Resource.Read
7  ( -- * Read resource
8    resRead,
9    resReadSingle,
10    resReadBz,
11    resReadString,
12  ) where
13
14import qualified Control.Monad.State                     as M
15import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy                    as Bz
16import qualified System.Directory                        as Dir
17import qualified System.FilePath                         as Path
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                as O
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                    as B
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                  as S
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data                    as D
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap             as C
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Resource.Include   as C
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Resource.Resource  as C
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Resource.Message   as Msg
26
27
28-- --------------------------------------------  I/O with global
29
30-- | I/O with global state.
31type GlobalIO a c = M.StateT (C.Global c) IO a
32
33-- | Calculation that returns abortable resource.
34type ResourceIO c = GlobalIO (C.AbResource c) c
35
36-- | Run state monad with global state.
37globalIO :: (C.Resource c -> GlobalIO a c) -> C.Global c -> IO (a, C.Global c)
38globalIO f g =
39    let g' = setGlobal g
40    in M.runStateT (f $ C.globalHook g') g'
41
42-- | Set global data to root resource.
43setGlobal :: O.Map (C.Global c)
44setGlobal g =
45    let root = C.globalHook g
46    in  g { C.globalHook = root { C.resGlobal = g }}
47
48-- | Get and update 'C.globalSourceCount'.
49nextSourceCount :: GlobalIO Int c
50nextSourceCount =
51    do g <- M.get
52       let n = 1 + C.globalSourceCount g
53       M.put $ g { C.globalSourceCount = n }
54       return n
55
56
57-- --------------------------------------------  Read resource
58
59-- | Read data resource from lazy bytestring.
60resReadBz :: (D.CContent c) => C.Resource c -> B.Bz -> C.AbResource c
61resReadBz base code = C.resInclude [] "" base (B.codeIxIO code) code
62
63-- | Read data resource from text.
64resReadString :: (D.CContent c) => C.Resource c -> String -> C.AbResource c
65resReadString base code = resReadBz base $ B.stringBz code
66
67-- | Read data resource from single input point.
68resReadSingle :: (D.CContent c) => C.Global c -> B.IOPoint -> IO (C.AbResource c, C.Global c)
69resReadSingle g src = globalIO single g where
70    single root = resReadLimit 1 root [src]
71
72-- | Read data resource from multiple input points.
73resRead :: (D.CContent c) => C.Global c -> [B.IOPoint] -> IO (C.AbResource c, C.Global c)
74resRead g src = globalIO proc g where
75    proc root = do let limit = C.globalSourceLimit g
76                   resReadLimit limit root src
77
78resReadLimit :: (D.CContent c) => Int -> C.Resource c -> [B.IOPoint] -> ResourceIO c
79resReadLimit limit root src =
80    readQueue limit $ root { C.resInputQueue = (B.qFrom ready, []) }
81    where ready = map input $ reverse src
82          input pt = C.InputPoint pt []
83
84-- | Read input at most given limit on the queue.
85readQueue :: (D.CContent c) => Int -> C.Resource c -> ResourceIO c
86readQueue limit res@C.Resource { C.resInputQueue = (q, done) }
87    | limit <= 0  = return $ Right res
88    | otherwise   = proc $ B.deq q
89    where
90      proc (Nothing, _) = return $ Right res
91      proc (Just src, q')
92          | B.IxIOPoint 0 srcPt `elem` done = readQueue limit' pop  -- skip
93          | otherwise                       = readOne
94          where
95            limit'   = limit - 1
96            srcPt    = C.inputPoint src
97            srcAbout = C.inputPointAbout src
98            pop      = res { C.resInputQueue = (q', done) }
99            readOne  = do n <- nextSourceCount
100                          let src' = B.IxIOPoint n srcPt
101                          abres' <- readCode pop src' srcAbout
102                          case abres' of
103                            Right res' -> readQueue limit' $ C.resQueueDone src' res'
104                            left       -> return left
105
106-- | Read resource from certain source.
107readCode :: forall c. (D.CContent c) =>
108    C.Resource c -> B.IxIOPoint -> [S.TTree] -> ResourceIO c
109readCode res src add = dispatch $ B.nioPoint src where
110    dispatch (B.IOPointFile cd path) = M.liftIO $ do
111         let path' = putDir cd path
112             cd'   = putDir cd $ Path.dropFileName path
113         exist <- Dir.doesFileExist path'
114         case exist of
115           True   -> includeUnder cd' =<< Bz.readFile path'
116           False  -> return $ Msg.noFile cd path
117
118    dispatch (B.IOPointUri url) =
119        do g <- M.get
120           let proxy = C.globalProxy g
121           abcode <- M.liftIO $ B.uriContent proxy url
122           M.liftIO $ case abcode of
123             Right code       -> include code
124             Left (code, msg) -> return $ Msg.httpError url code msg
125
126    dispatch (B.IOPointText   _ code) = M.liftIO $ include code
127    dispatch (B.IOPointCustom _ code) = M.liftIO $ include code
128    dispatch (B.IOPointStdin _)       = lift $ include =<< Bz.getContents
129    dispatch _                        = B.bug "read resource"
130
131    putDir dir path  = cutDot dir ++ cutDot path
132
133    cutDot ('.' : '/' : path) = cutDot path
134    cutDot path               = path
135
136    include :: B.Bz -> IO (C.AbResource c)
137    include = includeUnder ""
138
139    includeUnder :: FilePath -> B.Bz -> IO (C.AbResource c)
140    includeUnder cd = return . C.resInclude add' cd res src
141
142    add' = concatMap B.untree add
143
144    lift :: IO a -> GlobalIO a c
145    lift = M.liftIO
146
